messages: Obamacare was designed on the principle that health care coverage that's affordable, accessible to all, and free from discrimination should be a right, not a privilege. We can't afford to let opponents roll that back. Obamacare is working Since it became law, the uninsured rate has been cut in half, lifetime caps are a thing of the past—and more.

Thanks to Obamacare, millions of Americans have gained quality, affordable health care—and the uninsured rate has now dropped to a historic low. http://ofa.bo/2bW7qOO For the first time ever, America’s uninsured rate has fallen below 9 percent More Americans have health insurance than ever before.

Since Obamacare passed, experts are projecting significantly lower spending on health care than they originally expected—all while reducing the uninsured rate. The US is spending trillions less than expected on health care The United States is spending trillions — yes, trillions — less on health care than government forecasters expected when Obamacare passed in 2010. Back then, the Center for Medicare and Medicaid...
More than 90 precent of Americans now have health coverage. http://ofa.bo/c5xn Uninsured rate hits record low under ObamaCare Only 9.1 percent were uninsured in 2015, down from 14.4 percent in 2013.

The uninsured rate is down to single digits for the first time ever. That's a reason to celebrate. http://ofa.bo/f9Cx 16 million fewer uninsured since Obamacare, study finds The CDC report finds the uninsured rate fell by about a third since 2013.

States that embraced Obamacare saw a much bigger drop in uninsured rates this year: http://ofa.bo/g99w Uninsured Rate Down Way More In States That Embraced Obamacare Nationwide, the uninsured rate fell from 17.3 percent in 2013 to 11.7 percent through the first half of this year, following two years of sign-ups for private health insurance on the Obamacare exchanges and for expanded Medicaid benefits, the pollsters found.

Obamacare is lowering the uninsured rate and improving Americans' health—especially in states that expanded Medicaid. http://ofa.bo/c4uV Obamacare's side effects: Fewer uninsured, better health States that expanded Medicaid programs saw bigger gains in insured rates, as well as access to doctors and medicines, than other states.
Obamacare is working. http://ofa.bo/b4y6 Uninsured rate hits lowest level to date, boosting Obamacare The uninsured rate has dropped to 11.4 percent, according to Gallup.

This is why we can't move backward on health care reform. http://ofa.bo/b4On Uninsured Rate Gets Lower And Lower, Thanks To Obamacare WASHINGTON-- The Affordable Care Act was designed to slash the percentage of Americans who lack health insurance, and it's working. The uninsured rate fell to 11.9 percent during the first quarter of this year, 1 percentage point below the rate at...

The uninsured rate continues to fall through the first two months of 2015, thanks to the Affordable Care Act. http://ofa.bo/g3L4 Snapshot: U.S. Uninsured Rate Edging Down in First Quarter The percentage of U.S. adults lacking health insurance coverage has declined marginally to 12.3% so far in the first quarter of 2015, from 12.9% in the fourth quarter of 2014.

The uninsured rate has dropped 4.2 percent since the Affordable Care Act went into effect: http://ofa.bo/i2Fg In U.S., Uninsured Rate Sinks to 12.9% The percentage of uninsured U.S. adults dipped to 12.9% in the fourth quarter of 2014, from 13.4% in the third quarter. The uninsured rate is down 4.2 percentage points since the Affordable Care Act went into effect in January 2014.

The uninsured rate is nearing a record low: http://ofa.bo/s22q Number of Uninsured Americans Near Record Low The percentage of Americans without health insurance was near historic lows this year following the roll-out of the Affordable Care Act.

The uninsured rate is dropping—fast. http://ofa.bo/c0Bh It sure looks like Obamacare is driving down the uninsured rate The uninsured rate keeps on falling, the most recent round of Gallup poll data shows.

The percentage of uninsured Americans is shrinking, thanks to health care reform: http://ofa.bo/jcA
 A Big Sign of Obamacare Success Hey, Obamacare Truthers: Gallup just found the number of uninsured Americans is the lowest its found since 2008, when it started polling.
